page.title: 14TOURISM IN SKELMORLIE
page.content: Because of the scenic position on the Firth of Clyde,Skelmorlie and Wemyss Bay attract many summer visitors. The large hotels of heyday of Skel- morlie as a fashionable resort are gone and now caravan sites cater for the holiday maker. There are 3 sites in the area,the largest having 500 placements.Some people from nearby towns own a static caravan and spend every weekend here. Others rent or bring their own van. Wemyss Bay pier is the take off point for the Isle of Bute and Rothesay.One ferry runs each way each hour. Weekends on the main road are very busy as traffic to Largs and Ayr passes through.Local hotels do a good trade providing meals.There are also some bed and breakfast establishments.
